message: Hello Bob, I have a fantastic product that I think you'll really like. I'm looking to sell it to you for $250. Is this something you'd be interested in?
Thank you for the offer, Alice.  $250 is a bit higher than I'm comfortable with. I'm interested in the product, but I'm only able to offer $100 at this time.  Let me know what you think.

I understand that $100 is a bit low for me, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I can offer the product to you for $175. This is the lowest I can go, but I think it's a fair price for the quality of the product. Let me know if this is something you'd be interested in.

Alice, I appreciate you coming down in price, but $175 is still a bit more than I can afford right now.  I'm willing to go up to $125.  This is my final offer, as I'm really hoping to get this product.  Let me know what you think.

I understand that you're really interested in the product, Bob, but I'm not willing to go as low as $125. I'm willing to meet you halfway between $175 and $125, so I'm offering the product to you for $150. This is my final offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower.

Alice, I understand you're firm on your price, but unfortunately, $150 is still outside of my budget.  I'm prepared to pay $135.  This is a fair compromise that gets us both closer to our goals.  I really want this product and hope we can reach an agreement.

I appreciate your persistence, Bob, but I'm still not willing to go below $150. I'm willing to give you a slight discount, but I need to make sure I'm getting a fair price for the product. I'm offering it to you for $147.50. This is my final offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower.
